definition[0]: an occasion when you can see a film, play, painting etc before it is shown to the public
example[0]: the press preview of the show  (=when people who write for newspapers, television etc could see it)
example[1]: a sneak preview of the new fashions for autumn
definition[1]: a description of a film, television programme, show etc that people will be able to see soon
definition[2]: to see or describe something before it is shown to the public
example[2]: Journalists will be able to preview the exhibition tomorrow.
definition[3]: to show or perform something before it is shown to the public
example[3]: The band will preview their new album on 2nd March.
definition[4]: an occasion when you see a product, film, record etc, before it is made generally available to the public
example[4]: Today we can give you a preview of the new Nikon professional digital camera.
